fields.description:
Possible implementation options:
* Give a drop down of the "known" usernames:
** Unassigned
** Default
** Parent issue reporter
** Parent issue assignee
** Current user
* Just add a text box, the user would need to know the username of the assignee. JIRA would return "User does not exist" if it was wrong
* Implement the autocomplete (this could be applied to more autocomplete fields)

From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/190361/crucible-how-to-create-inline-issue-with-assignee-field
fields.summary: Support user pickers in Inline Issue Creation

fields.description:
Either by adding a couple more "important" fields, eg Priority, Assignee

or by making it configurable at a global level - if the field exists it is shown.

All required fields would still be shown, these would be additional fields. Currently the description field is included, for example.

From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/190361/crucible-how-to-create-inline-issue-with-assignee-field
fields.summary: Allow non required fields in Inline Issue Creation

fields.description:
When I select the Create Issue link from a Crucible code review comment, I get the following message:

No project permissions

You do not have permission to create issues in any of the projects on this JIRA server.

I have Jira version > 5.x

I use Jira for authentication, and it works

I have application links setup, which works. I can create a Code Review from Jira.

I and everyone else have appropriate "Comment" permissions in crucible permission scheme

I've verified the permissions scheme is set to the one granting these user's comment permission

I've added the jira groups these users are in as well, which didn't help.

If I place a JIRA ID of a valid issue in the comment, that works and jira opens.

The error happens in numerous browsers, for any users that try it.

OS: CentOS6.2 64-bit
DB: Postgresql 9.2.4
Fisheye/Crucible: 3.0.1
Java: java version "1.6.0_24"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.11.11) (rhel-1.61.1.11.11.el6_4-x86_64)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.0-b12, mixed mode)

I am using an apache reverse proxy in front of both, but as stated above, user auth works, application links work.
fields.summary: Create Issue link in crucible code review comment displays error

fields.description:
The following is reproducible as an author/moderator or reviewer:
* In a review, create 1 draft comment
* Summarize (if author/moderator)
* Warning window will appear that there is draft comments
* Click on the "View drafts"
* Nothing happens. The warning window remains
* If I cancel and refresh the browser, Crucible is able to "View drafts" after clicking on Summarize -> View drafts

The above is true for the "Complete" function for reviewers.
fields.summary: Crucible does not go to the draft comment after clicking on "View drafts"

fields.description: When you download a review as text from Crucible, the lines do not wrap, they seem to have artificial line breaks based on spacing from the online review.  This causes a lot of manual cleanup effort if you want the text report to match the page margins you've set on the text document.
fields.summary: Download review to text has inaccurate line breaks

fields.description:
This would make it easier to refer to a specific comment when holding review meetings, etc.  As it is, some reviews have hundred of comments and replies, and finding the specific one(s) you want to discuss in a meeting can be problematic.  

Replies don't necessarily need a number, just the initial Comment/Defect.
fields.summary: Would like top-level comments/defects to have identifying number

fields.description:
When I include an issue key in a commit message, that commit automatically shows up under the "Source" tab in JIRA as expected. It would be nice if a parent issue showed all commits for its children issue as well.

For example, let's say I have ISSUE-1 with sub tasks ISSUE-2 and ISSUE-3. I make two commits to fix ISSUE-1, one with ISSUE-2 in the comment and one with ISSUE-3 in the comment. I would now like to create a Crucible review for ISSUE-1 but no commits show up for ISSUE-1. Because ISSUE-2 and ISSUE-3 are subtasks of ISSUE-1, it would be nice if their commits were grouped together and showed up in ISSUE-1.
fields.summary: Source tab for parent issue in JIRA should show child issue commiits

fields.description:
# Create a Project with the Key "Foo"
# Create a Review in Foo
# Delete the Project Foo, moving the Reviews to "CR"
# Create a Project with the Key "FoO"
# Try to create a Review in "FoO"

We should ensure that review sequence numbers within a project do not duplicate those in dleted projects which have the same (case insensitive) key.
fields.summary: Deleting and recreating projects with keys which differ only in case can cause NonUniqueResultException on Viewing Review

fields.description: In the left hand file tree, display the comment count as a before the file name. This is valuable in scenarios where the file tree displays long file names or deeply nested files, and viewing the comment count requires constant readjustment of the size of the file tree pane.
fields.summary: Display read/unread comment count before filenames

"Starting FishEye/Crucble... Output redirected to path/to/fisheye.out" to STDOUT

Crucible is misspelled. Again, very minor.

fields.description:
There is an issue with the Edit Review Details button in our crucible instance which is pretty much stopping us dead in our tracks.

I get 2 different errors, and I have attached screenshots of both.
* Upon page refresh click the "Edit Review Details" button. We get the following error:
!crucible_error_not_responding.png|thumbnail!
* Instead of Reload, click 'Close', then 'Done' and click the "Edit Review Details" button. Now the error becomes:
!crucible_error_edit-detailsundefined.png|thumbnail!
There is a Error pane behing the empty Edit Review Pane which contains the following errors:
{code}
Error
Not Found
Error 2
A com.opensymphony.xwork.config.ConfigurationException was encountered

There is no Action mapped for namespace /cru and action name edit-detailsundefined. Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xwork.xml and also if such an action class exists. Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded.
{code}
fields.summary: "Edit Review Details" errors with "The server is not responding" but the server is ok

fields.description:
Hi team,

It was going to be awesome if we have a feature to use wildcards on file contents, for example:
"suppose that we need to find all variables containing the word "name". The variables names could be "firstname", "previousname", "names" and so on. Normally whe will use something like "Name" to get all the file containing this word in all is differents forms."

What you think?

Thanks
fields.summary: Ant Globs in file contents

fields.description:
We use automatic reviews creator, because of that we have a lot of reviews.
Today is very hard close or summarize several reviews.
I thinks it should be something like mark email as readed in GMail
fields.summary: Please allow close several reviews at the same time

fields.description:
Completed reviews with new comments should be displayed in Dashboard Inbox.

Today is very hard find reviews with new comments in hundred of completed reviews in Outbox.
fields.summary: Reviews with new comments should be displayed in Inbox

fields.description:
Seems like there is (or was in previous releases) a bug causing Crucible to store null paths in cru_stored_paths table.  Until 3.0 FECRU release this was not causing any problems, but 3.0 requires all paths to be unique.  The database upgrade script would fail though if more than one null stored path exists.

Testing notes:
 * test upgrade  for 2.10 (or any other prior to 3.0) instance, 3.0.0 and 3.0.1 (or later) instances  (in 3.0.1 there was change introduced to cope with null paths: http://fisheye.dev.internal.atlassian.com/changelog/FE-hg?cs=cd49a1572a3ac61f8f7a455de8a7d8894a806813) 
 * test with:
 ** non empty cru_feindex_msg table (for existing and non existing repositories)
 ** reviews with FRXes pointing to null paths (how they're displayed in the review?)
 ** duplicated not null paths from same source (repository) and same revision (i.e. where cru_revision_cru_source_name_cru_path_cru_revision_key constraint would fail)

seems like DedupeStoredPathUpgradeTask when merging CrucibleRevisions (cru_revision) entities is picking one to merge with arbitrarily, which may not necessarily be the best.   Can't see an easy way to determine which is right, perhaps we could log them at least as WARNings in the log?
fields.summary: upgrade to 3.x release occasionally fails when deduplicating paths in db

fields.description:
It is a common question from my clients:

How to find out the number of reviews created for a specific month for a specific crucible project.

We almost have the answer on the Review Dashboard page. with the following small enhancement our users will be able to find the answer easily:
1) add a column in the output providing the review creation date
2) add a "time interval filter" under "Custom Filter" section, allowing us to specify, e.g., the specific month.
fields.summary: Report: Get the number of review created per month

fields.description: We use HP ALM for defect traction and we would like to integrate with Crucible.
fields.summary: HP ALM integration with Crucible

fields.description:
How do I export all crucible review comments of a project to excel?
 I am using crucible v2.7.7

I want to export all (500-1000) review comments / defects of a project, with all details like Review ID, reviewer name, creation date and all custom fields (crucible defect classifications : ranking, classification etc) as separate columns in an excel sheet.

Crucible doesnt seem to give me this option by default.

I tried to use a MS SQL query to directly get the data from the DB, but am unable to find the tables where the Crucible "Defect Classification" fields are stored.

Is there an easier way to get this data?
 This is needed in our organization for varoius other reports.
 Now getting this data out is a major overhead and team is questioning the usage of crucible because of this overhead.
if you could give me a temporary workaround while you implement this feature, that would be great.
fields.summary: Have a export feature for all review comments into excel

fields.description:
When adding multiple commits for a file to a review and one of the commit contains the add of the file the file won't be shown as new. Only changes after the first commit will be marked as new.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
- Create some commits, one should contain the add of a file, the others should have some changes for the file.
- Add all commits to the review
- Start the review and select the file
- Files won't be shown as newly added, and only changes after the first (add-)commit will be shown as changed
fields.summary: File creation is not displayed as change

fields.description:
Symptoms include getting an error similar to 'diff: conflicting output style options' in the debug log.

A workaround is to unset the variable before running the script.

We should probably detect that's it's set, unset it when executing p4, and restore it before exiting.
fields.summary: If the P4DIFF environment variable is set, the crucible.py review tool might not be able to get the patch properly

fields.description: Display problems of drop down edit boxes when creating review on Firefox 17 (Ubuntu lastest version).
fields.summary: Display problems of drop down edit boxes on Firefox 17

fields.description: GIT users in Crucible to be discriminated by e-mail, not first/last name. Because in GIT e-mail is unique, but name of committer/author could be anything.
fields.summary: GIT users in Crucible to be discriminated by e-mail

fields.description:
On some tables there are no user names, but only profile pictures. Which for more larger companies is harder to orientate. It will be good if there is a possibility to show user names. 
One is to show them if we resize window.
fields.summary: Display of user names in tables

fields.description:
Possibility to display the commit message from the patch. 
Currently we have to copy-paste patch message when creating the review. If we have many patches from a branch it becomes harder.
fields.summary: Displaying patch commit message

fields.description:
It could be implemented in different ways. But the most obvious is to support multiple file selection during uploading patches.
In our workflow we upload many patches to the same review (for example - whole branch). So this feature could help for more faster and easier usability.
fields.summary: Possibility to upload many patches at once

fields.description: Currently one of our workflows include downloading and application of all review patches (if they are okay) at once. So we have to click file by file to download them all.
fields.summary: Possibility to download all review patches at once

fields.description: Currently it is not obvious what is the order of five patches uploaded onto the review. Which is the latest? When it is uploaded?
fields.summary: Displaying of patch upload date and time

fields.description:
Hi Team,

There are some customers who want to integrate FishEye with onDemand JIRA.
Nowadays they need to set up the application on default web http and https ports.

But for some customers it's not an option, to change the application ports.

It was going to be really awesome if they could do this configuration with 8060 and 8443 ports using self signed certificates.

Is this possible?

Thanks a lot.
Celso Yoshioka
fields.summary: Application links using other ports than 80 and 443

fields.description:
Oftentimes while working on a larger review, I'll find myself using draft comments as a personal indicator for where I currently am in a certain file, or as a note that I'll want to come back and look at some line before closing out the review. Since these comments are mostly serving as placeholders while I gather more information from other parts of the review, I find it frustrating to be forced to type "asdf" before saving a comment, especially since when I then want to actually coalesce my thoughts into a coherent comment, I now have to delete the aforementioned gibberish before proceeding.

The two-phased interruption in my workstream is disruptive and seems unnecessary - there is already a check when completing the review for draft comments, which will inherently capture empty comments as well. I, as a user, should be allowed to make as many empty comments as I want, provided I remove them when closing the review.
fields.summary: Allow empty draft comments while reviewing

fields.description:
Need to enable Crucible for automation project:
Automation prject is https://forge.avaya.com/projects/automation/
Crubicle project should be like on summary page:
 Crucible Project: CR-AUTOMATION
 - https://crucible.forge.avaya.com/project/CR-AUTOMATION

The SVN structure must be like
/project1/trunk/...
/project1/branches/b1
/project1/branches/b2
/project1/branches/...
 
/project1/tags/t1
/project1/tags/t2
/project1/tags/...
fields.summary: Need to enable Crucible for automation project

fields.description:
Currently, any user display name is wiki rendered in a crucible comment.

We need to ensure that display names are not wiki rendered. This is especially a problem for hyphenated names.

Steps to reproduce
1) Create a comment and mention the user that has special characters in name like "tom *the might*" or "I'm -the leader-"
fields.summary: Never wiki-render Display Names in Crucible comments

fields.summary: Deletion of patches from a review

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a patch with "UTF-8 without BOM" encoding
# Upload the patch to a review
# Multibyte character (japanese) is corrupted
fields.summary: Multibyte characters corrupted in patch with "UTF-8 without BOM" encoding

fields.description:
From gbonehead:

We'd like to use Crucible for collaborative code reviews, but find it to be really really awkward. The problem is that we have a group of N people all entering comments, and when the review is complete most of them should be modified or deleted - yet only the author of the comment can modify it.

The moderator should really be able to edit and/or delete any comment in a review - after all, they ARE the moderator - which would help a finalized review actually have useful information rather than a bunch of stream of consciousness commentary of unknown and potentially dubious value.

Does anyone know how to set up permissions for Crucible so a single person can unify and clean up the comments?

See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Adding+comments?focusedCommentId=370704730#comment-370704730
fields.summary: Allow moderator, or other role, to delete review comments

fields.description: If using the pre-commit tool the added files can get truncated to include just the first line instead of the whole file.
fields.summary: Review pre-commit tool can fail to include all the lines for an added file with Perforce

fields.description:
Some customers may specify restrictive socketTimeout option, which would cause any long lasting DB statements to be interrupted with this timeout.

This may seem sensible during standard Web interactions where instance admins may want to interrupt long running queries.  But at the same time it might be very harmful when applied during upgrade process, as it could easily leave database in the inconsistent state, being half upgraded from one version to another.  In edge cases it may require manual intervention as db upgrade script may not allow to be rerun if partial changes were already applied.
fields.summary: Crucible upgrade may fail in the middle if DB socket timeout too short

fields.description:
Hi there,

I think that was going to be great if we can have a backup integrity checker.

I think that after create the zip file the application should save the md5 signature to compare before restoring this backup.

This way we could be always sure that the backup is correct when user creates and restores it.

One example of software that does it to check integrity is clockworkmod for android.

Regards.
Celso Yoshioka,
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Backup integrity verification

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Install FishEye & Crucible with 10 user license for each product
# Add 10 users
# Disable FishEye
# Load 5 user license for Crucible

The error message that displays will indicate that the FishEye license has been exceeded. Since FishEye isn't installed we should clarify the error message that the TOTAL number of users in the users list must not exceed the number of licensed users when using only Crucible.

See attached screenshot for a _similar_ error.
fields.summary: Crucible only license displays a FishEye license exceeded error message

fields.description:
Currently, when a review is closed, a linked JIRA issue can be transitioned.

However, it is not possible to edit other fields on the issue (except for Resolution).

Need the ability to edit other required fields when transitioning the issue too.
fields.summary: Support editing other field on the issue when transition a linked issue

fields.description:
Apologies if this duplicates an issue; I have searched and could not find.

I would like to be able to suggest code fragments in review comments, but by default, they are rendered illegible by the wiki in-band signaling problem. (That is, characters that are common in code fragments have special meaning to the wiki markup interpreter.)

I would like to be able to disable wiki markup for review comments and just type plain text. JIRA has the same problem, and I'm now in the habit of typing {noformat} at the beginning and end of every issue.

But why on earth should pretty markup, rather than useful behaviour, be the default anyway? ;-)
fields.summary: can't type code fragments in review comments because wiki
Ability to auto delete old scheduled backup
Ability to enforce a number of reviewer in a review

fields.description:
Crucible reviews are browsable per file. The left-side column shows a tree with the files modified by the commits that are part of the review.
On a review that includes, say three commits, I'm not able to review the changes on a per commit basis.
h4. Example Use case:
- Commit 1 modifies file A (for example adds a new function)
- Commit 2 modifies files A and  B (fixes a bug)
- Commit 3 modifies files A, B, and C (adds additional functionality)

The review will show the three files, but this has some problems:
- By selecting file A, I will be presented with the changes from all three commits. 
- Even though I can use the commit slider to restrict the changes per commit (for example commit 2), this will limit to display only file A, but a commit usually makes sense as a whole (changes in A and B).
- The commit message, which contains key information about what the change is about is almost hidden and only visible by hovering with the mouse over the commits SHA1, and then it shows poorly formatted.

h4.Suggestion
My suggestion is to add the possibility of having a different view to browse code reviews per commit. In this view, the left side bar would be a commit tree navigator. Selecting a commit will show the changes to all the affected files on the right side (one file after the other).
Additionally, the files could be selected to navigate to the start of each one.
The commit message would display at the top, clearly formatted.
This would be somewhat similar to what gitk browser shows.
!crucible.png!
The idea would be to have a layout like this:
|.|.|Commit message|
|Commit Selector|File selector|File1|
|.|.|File2|
|.|.|File3|
fields.summary: Allow to do reviews per commits/changelogs, rather than per file

fields.description:
Hi All I am on crucible 2.7 On the Dashboard we have four tabs.

The first one is the tab ALL On clicking the tab ALL we get info such as PROJECTXXX-200 commented on review or PROJECTxxx-200 replied to UserZZZ like that.

 as a reviewer if i raise a defect; still the tab mentions it as PROJECTXXX-200 commented on review rather than PROJECTXXX-200 raised a defect (this is a bit misleading)

Can we amend the message displayed please?

Rahul
fields.summary: Review activity stream messaging

fields.description:
If you go to the command line tool installation help button in Crucible 3.0.0, it goes here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+reviews+from+the+command+line#Creatingreviewsfromthecommandline-InstallingtheReviewCLItool

and it's a page that has been locked it says.
fields.summary: Command line tool help leads to a locked page

fields.description:
Hi,

I've made a backup from crucible version 2.4.x and restored it on a new installation, also an other server with crucible version 3.0.
Only we're missing a couple of reviews that are still existing on the old installation, but missing on the new installation.


Backup was done by the webinterface, and i checked every checkbox.

Restore process: 
 ./fisheyectl.sh restore --cache --username crucible --password XXxxXxXx --jdbcurl jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/crucible --dbtype mysql --file ../../backup_2013-03-06_1221.zip

Please take a look,

Thanks !
Siebren Zwerver | System Engineer
GamePoint B.V.
fields.summary: Backup & Restore, missing reviews.
duplicated null cru_stored_path rows leads to 3.0 upgrade problems

fields.description:
Currently the file list on the left only shows whether I, as a reviewer, have opened that file. It would be great to see a small progress bar indicating whether any other reviewer have already reviewed this file or what percentage of reviewers have reviewed it.

This is useful when there is a big review with a dozen files and many reviewers are added. It is not always necessary for every reviewer to review every changed file, but it would be good if every file was reviewed by at least one reviewer. To know this we need to know the status of individual files.
fields.summary: Add a review progress bar for individual files in the review
smart commit plugin: support creation of closed reviews

fields.description: By supporting the Git extended diff format Crucible will be able to use rename information from the patch and present a more accurate patch to the reviewers.
fields.summary: Support Mercurial patches generated with "hg export --git"
Application link documentation should be amended

fields.description:
The listing of reviewers is truncated to 49 users but there isn't any information displayed to the end user.

!http://monosnap.com/image/gMJoOQwgvZq4PdAq8gQaB7yMx.png!
fields.summary: Indicate that the listing of reviewers is truncated in the Edit Details view

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to filter reviews to show a list of reviews with unread comments.

We have a pretty informal process and it is difficult to know when a review needs attention because a comment has been entered.  The comment emails are useful but in an environment where there are many reviews in process all at once the ability to go to Crucible and list the reviews with unread comments (regardless of state) separately from all reviews would be extremely useful.

This seemed to have been covered in CRUC-2938 but that issue was closed due to inactivity rather than satisfaction of the request.
fields.summary: Sort Reviews by the Presence of Unread Comments

fields.description:
I create a cruciblereview from a changeset. The changeset message contains a Jira IssueId. The result is that the review is created with the Jira IssueId in the Field "Linked Issue". What about the Field "Linked Review"? If the changeset message contains a Crucible ReviewId it won´t be applied to the Field "Linked Review", but it should.

[Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/170914/create-review-and-detect-linked-review]
fields.summary: Create review and detect linked review in changeset message

fields.description: The Rest API currently lacks the ability to set the defect classification when working with comments.  You can simply mark it as a defect which is insufficient.  We would like the ability to set the defect classifications through the REST API.
fields.summary: As a REST API user I would like to set the defect classifications when working with comments

fields.description:
Hi there,

It was going to be great if Crucible could provide reports that captures all of the comments & issues created during a code review, including references to the files and line numbers of the relevant code.

Thanks,
Celso Yoshioka
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Reports from Crucible with JIRA information.

fields.description:
In peer review, inputs should default to defect as this is the point of peer review. Currently, users have to manually check the "defect check box" to create a defect. This seem to be an unnecessary step.

Alternatively, have this feature be configurable on a per project bases.
fields.summary: Change default behavior of user input to Defect instead of Comment

fields.description:
Currently, after saving the snippet content, you cannot change it anymore.
If later on the user realizes that something must be changed before it's reviewed, he cannot change it.
fields.summary: Snippet content should be editable

fields.description:
When adding a changeset to a review, the author field will be automatically populated by the username. There isn't any option to select 'any'.

*Workaround*
Remove the name in the author field and select a branch to update the it.
fields.summary: New option 'any'  for author field when adding a changeset to a review

fields.description:
Currently, Crucible is designed to only handle a a single "parent" JIRA Issue, so that it can create sub-tasks from review defects off it if needed.  You can still reference other JIRA issues by including them in the description.  However, the Crucible review link only appears in JIRA on the Review tab for that one parent issue.  

In some circumstances when there are multiple JIRA issues and revisions that apply to a file, it is easier to launch a single review with the first and last revision for comparison, rather than multiple reviews on each revision.  I would love a new feature that allows me to set "secondary" JIRA Issues for reference/integration purposes only, so that I can have that single review show up on the Review tab of multiple (related) JIRA issues.  I don't need those "secondary" JIRA issues to have sub-task creation capabilities.
fields.summary: Incomplete Crucible-JIRA integration when multiple JIRA issues apply

fields.description:
In the Crucible sidebar, there is a file list and the files are color coded based on whether they have been added, edited, or deleted.  These colors are VERY hard for color-blind people to see.  Instead of using the same visual indicator next to them, you could have some way of signifying whether the file is added, edited, or deleted.  Color updates might help, but something else would be even better.

See attachment
fields.summary: Better (color-blind-aware) indicators for files added/edited/deleted

fields.description:
If you are not paying careful attention, it is easy to start reviewing a Closed review, which is a waste of time.

Please consider adding some visual indicator (like a red ribbon) at the top of closed reviews to clearly show they are closed and save people time.
fields.summary: Visual indicator that a review is closed

fields.description:
Suppose I am reviewing a file and want to take a look at the file in the context of other files in the repo, other files that were not changed in the changeset and hence are not part of the review. I would have thought a quick way to jump from the crucible review view to the fisheye source view would be possible, but the fastest way I can find involves two clicks (fisheye/view file history, source - see screenshot). (Of course, one can get to the source files via the repo over the source tab, but this takes even longer.) Support has confirmed that there is no faster way (see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-5322). 

A "view source" option in the fisheye menu would be welcome here.

Note that CRUC-6461 is a more general solution that goes in the same direction. Even with that feature, a quick way to jump to the fisheye view would not hurt.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a quick way to jump from the crucible review view of a file to the fisheye source view.

fields.description:
How to Reproduce:
1. Add a file as "Whole file"
2. Change the file in the repo
3. Select "File Outdated" -> "Add Latest"

The file is now shown as diff instead of as "whole file".
fields.summary: "Add Latest" adds diff instead of whole file

fields.description: Those two functions use {{CommonRevInfoDAO.searchChangeSetRevids}} which can be very slow for a changeset with millions of rev ids. We should skip these functions for very large change sets.
fields.summary: Very large changesets are slow to display because of pertinantRevInfosInChangeset and getReviewsForChangeset

fields.description:
Hi!
I am using fecru-2.8. I have synced a remote git repository having 15000 branches and 9000 tags. All branches and tags are synced into my crucible server but they are not getting displayed on crucible UI on searching. I am unable to create review as files are not getting displayed on UI source tab while searching by giving bug branch name. It is priority issue and i am stuck since last 2 weeks and unable to find any solution. Kindly help me out of this issue.

regards,
Mamuni
fields.summary: All branches of git repositories are not getting displayed on fisheye crucible UI

fields.description:
When the issue being viewed in JIRA is created from Inline Issue Creation the image link is not fetched if the user is not logged into Crucible and anonymous access is disabled

!https://api.monosnap.com/image/download?id=BZCKXZm3jzuD63F77D068xAyS!

The resource being fetched is /currentstatic/images/crucible.ico which redirects to the login page instead of the static resource.
fields.summary: Inline issue creation: when not logged in to Crucible the review comment icon is not fetched

fields.description:
I have written crucible event listener plug-in to listen to events. The plug-in is able to listen to CommentCreatedEvent, CommentUpdatedEvent... but CommentDeletedEvent is never triggered/invoked by crucible tool even after comment is deleted from Review. 

I have programmed the listener for crucible 2.9.2 version. The same plug-in used to work on crucible 2.6.0 version.
  
The listener can be found as attachment.
fields.summary: CommentDeletedEvent is not getting triggered.

fields.description: Crucible integrates with several Source Control systems like git.  I would like to see Crucible support TFS.
fields.summary: Integrate with TFS

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to search for Git CommitDate during the creation or when adding content to a code review. Currently the date fields for searching are based on Git AuthorDate and not on CommitDate.

This is related to [FE-4074|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4074].
fields.summary: Extend Search Functionality to Include Git CommitDate

fields.description:
Currently, the message will be only dismissed by clicking on the "Dismiss" button. However, it could be closed in some other ways, e.g., clicking on the rest of the page or auto-hiding. In such way, the dialog is not actually dismissed and will come up again next time which causes confusion to the user.

At the moment, we cannot force the aui inline-dialog to stay visible until it is closed programmatically, so we cannot implement the correct behaviour for a feature discovery message now. The fix is done on https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-1260 and will be in aui-5.1

However, for the time being, we will just dismiss the message when it is closed, whichever way it is used to close the message.
fields.summary: Dismiss barracuda's feature discovery message when it is closed.

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Add a new SVN property to a file:
{noformat}
$ svn propset svn:mime-type "application/x-sh" filename
{noformat}
# Commit the changes eg: revision 2
{noformat}
$ svn diff -r 1:2 filename
Index: filename
===================================================================
--- filename    (revision 1)
+++ filename    (revision 2)

Property changes on: filename
___________________________________________________________________
Added: svn:mime-type
## -0,0 +1 ##
+application/x-sh
\ No newline at end of property
{noformat}
# Change the SVN property value:
{noformat}
svn propset svn:mime-type "text/x-shellscript" filename
{noformat}
# Commit the changes eg: revision 3
{noformat}
$ svn diff -r 2:3 filename 
Index: filename
===================================================================
--- filename    (revision 2)
+++ filename    (revision 3)

Property changes on: filename
___________________________________________________________________
Modified: svn:mime-type
## -1 +1 ##
-application/x-sh
+text/x-shellscript
\ No newline at end of property
{noformat}
# Try to add revision 2 to a review (the checkbox is grey out)
# Try to add revision 3 to the same review (success)

It seems that the SVN diff for property modification does not show the changes for file content:
{noformat}
$ svn diff -r 2:3 filename 
...
Modified: svn:mime-type
## -1 +1 ##
-application/x-sh
+text/x-shellscript
\ No newline at end of property
{noformat}
FishEye/Crucible think that there is a file content changes from the diff '## -1 +1 ##' and permit the addition of the diff to the review
fields.summary: Ignore SVN property change from reviews

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Edit a review
# Change the project to a non-existing project
# Click done (there is no changes and error)
# Edit the review again
# Change the project to a non-existing project
# Add a reviewer to the review
# Click done and the following error happen:
{noformat}
2013-05-03 16:08:44,739 ERROR [btpool0-12 ] fisheye TotalityFilter-logExceptionDetails - Exception "java.lang.NullPointerException" (javax.servlet.ServletException) while processing "/cru/postDetails.do" (Referer:"http://localhost:8060/cru/CR-1")
javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.DispatcherUtils.serviceAction(DispatcherUtils.java:284)
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:111)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:511)
	at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1272)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.rest.context.ContextFilter.doFilter(ContextFilter.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.crucible.actions.create.EditReviewDetailsAction.execute(EditReviewDetailsAction.java:338)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invokeAction(DefaultActionInvocation.java:358)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invokeActionOnly(DefaultActionInvocation.java:218)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:192)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.interceptors.ReviewInterceptor.intercept(ReviewInterceptor.java:51)
{noformat}
fields.summary: NPE thrown when trying to change project key
Multiple open transactions in idle instance

fields.description:
It would be nice to have support for performing offline reviews or commenting offline.

For example entering comments in some distinctive format in the source file or an IDE and importing the file into the review which picks out the comments and puts them in the right place as if they had been entered online.

An example in detail:
# Author ‘A’ has submitted two files ‘xyz.c’ and ‘xyz.h’ for review through Crucible to Reviewer ‘R’.
# ‘R’ is offline yet he has access to the modified files and aware of the changes.
# Now ‘R’ has started adding comments into ‘xyz.c & xyz.h’ in a standard format (see below sample format) 
[<Auth> : <File> : <Line> : <Col> : <Comment>] It’s something like this: 
[R : \\www.acme.com\..\xyz.c : 121 : 0 : “Please modify this line as…”]
# Now ‘R’ goes online and wants to upload this commented ‘xyz.c’ file into Crucible.
# When ‘A’ opens Crucible, he’d be able to see the comments in GUI (regular way)
fields.summary: Support for IDE/Offline Reviews

fields.description:
Sometimes a reviewer wants to look at other files in the code base, files that have not been changed in the changeset under review. Currently, he has to leave Crucible to do that (or go through a cumbersome process to add the file to the review, even if he may not want to comment the file).

Here is a different idea:

* The content of the review is actually considered as including all the files in the repo, not just the files that have been changed in the changeset(s) under review. (Or perhaps this could be considered the maximum content of the review, with the actual content being only the changed files plus whatever unchanged files have comments.)
* The state of the files is the exact state in the changeset currently selected for unchanged as well as changed files.
* There is an option to show only the changed files, which by default is on. I.e. no change in the status quo.
* If the option is turned off, the other files are shown and are available for comment without being added to the review by hand.
fields.summary: Add option to display unchanged files in the content of a review.

fields.description:
Hi,

many times I am reviewing the code in FeCru (in OnDemand on ServiceDog, v1.8r) on train using my Nexus 7 (I think iPad has same problem). There is no mobile website and the desktop version performs very badly on tablets. I think this use case is increasingly more popular because I do not need to take my laptop with me for just code reviews. Sometimes it's one or two reviews that I can do like this.
In comparison, when using BitBucket's code review, it also doesn't work completly optimal on tablets, but it's much more usable than FeCru.
fields.summary: Better mobile interface for FeCru

fields.description:
When viewing a review, hitting the left windows key will update the view to the next unread comment in the review. This is a usability issue, as hitting Windows + L to lock, or Windows + Q to open Office Communicator, Windows + [Num] to switch to the actual code file, etc will leave the user viewing a different part of the review than they were previously.

This has been duplicated in Chrome and Firefox. To reproduce, a review must have an unread comment, but that comment must not be "Kept Unread". When viewing a different file/line, press the left Windows key.
fields.summary: Windows key shows next unread comment

fields.description:
Hi Team,

It was going to be awesome if we can customize the FeCru activity stream item list to show it completely if there are to many items on it.

 This can be useful for some customers.
fields.summary: Expanded activity stream item list

fields.description:
Currently, when a Crucible review is downloaded and saved as text, it uses UTF-8, which I understand is the required character encoding for the DB and for crucible to operate correctly. 

However, when we read this file format back into something like MS Word, Word wants to default to IS0-8859-1 so certain characters, such as smart quotes show up funny. 

We can save the file format and ask word to convert it, but I'd rather see it automated. 

Is there are way to configure crucible so that it will do the conversion on the front end so when the data is downloaded and saved its IS0-8859-1 instead of UTF-8?
fields.summary: Can Crucible Output text in IS0-8859-1

fields.description:
my company requires that all defects be dispositioned. While crucible supports the creation of jira issue, this is still limiting. 
There are time multiple defects maps to a single issue. Which cannot be easily visualized in crucible. I propose that there is a drop down box that users can select linked jira issues to a crucible review that will prepopulate with issues created in the current crucible review.
fields.summary: Support for dispositioning of all defect

fields.description:
We are using the Tempo plugin in JIRA.
We have mandatory Tempo fields which get bypassed when time is logged from Crucible.
We would like to turn off the Crucible "Log Time" feature.
Please indicate a procedure if any. If not please implement a configuration option.
This is preventing us to go to production with Crucible.
fields.summary: Give the option to disable "Log Time to JIRA"

fields.description:
If automatic user synchronization is enabled from Crowd or LDAP, the synchronization thread may fail to close the db session used during the synchronization process.

If the connection pool is lower than the number of worker threads that perform the synchronization, this might lead to starving the connection pool.
fields.summary: Scheduled user synchronization doesn't close DB sessions

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create one Crucible review
# Add one comment in it
# Create Inline JIRA issue TEST-11
# Delete the issue TEST-11 from JIRA
# Crucible review "Issues Raised From Comments" showing "You are not permitted to view details of this issue" for TEST-11
fields.summary: "You are not permitted to view details of this issue" when the issue is deleted

fields.description:
An important aspect of a code review is following up on the comments and documenting the follow up. Crucible is limited in that respect now. Here is what I have in mind:

* Comments have an additional field, Resolution, similar in meaning to the same named field in Jira.
* A review has an additional section, Review Comments Status, which consists of a list of comments (the first line of each comment), the author, the changeset, the defect category (or nothing if the comment is not a defect), and the value of Resolution (fixed, won't fix, etc.). A link takes the user directly to the comment in context. The comment list can be filtered and sorted (like an Excel table).
* There are appropriate items in the Permission scheme for resolving comments.
* The Resolution values are configured for the Crucible instance (with defaults similar to those in Jira).
* There is a project option that requires comments to be resolved before a review may be closed.
* There are functions in CQL (Crucible Query Language) that allow the user to search for reviews with conditions based on comment resolution (e.g. reviews with unresolved comments).
fields.summary: As the author of a review, I would like to follow up comments by setting them to resolved.

fields.description:
When adding content to a review in Crucible, the author drop down list may contain the same username repeated over and over depending on how many email addresses have been mapped to it.

This is the current behaviour by design, ie. to filter by a specific committer via their email address. Since there are some users that might want to have it the other way around, it would be nice to have something like a "-My commits-" option, which would consider all the mappings, and set that as default.
fields.summary: Toggle Between Mapped and Non-Mapped Authors When Adding Content to a Review

fields.description:
Because Crucible doesn't support submodules please allow selecting repository folder in directory.

I want manually add to review revision from main repository and from git submodules
fields.summary: Allow select repository directory when adding revisions to review

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create Review in Crucible.
# Under "Add Content" add a pre-commit patch containing "---" (use attached [patch.txt|^patch] for example).
# Crucible [fails to identify the files in "insertions"|^screenshot1.png].
# To workaround this, just change to "-- -" (break the 3 dashes).

There is also [CRUC-856|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-856] describing similar problem but marked as fixed in 2.3.6
fields.summary: Pre-commit Review Incorrectly Identifies Files in Patch When Patch Contains "---" (3 Dashes)

fields.description:
- Start fecru with a fisheye and a crucible licence
- Index a repository
- Remove the FishEye licence
- Restart fecru
- Go to the admin dialog for the repo. It will be stopped.
- Click start -- a sensible error message is displayed: "Failed to start repository checkstyle: Problem loading repository 'checkstyle' - Current repository index for "checkstyle" is not compatible with your license, please re-index."
- Click close on the error box, then click start again, a poor error message is displayed: "Error calling server:com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.StatusCodeException: 500 The call failed on the server; see server log for details Unknown.anonymous(Unknown Source) Unknown.anonymous(Unknown Source) Unknown.anonymous(Unknown Source) Unknown.anonymous(Unknown Source) ..."
- Go to System Info, Edit license, and add a fisheye licence.
- Go back to the repository dialog for the stopped repo, and try to start it -- fisheye does not realise that we now have a valid licence, and gives the 'sensible' error message above
fields.summary: Providing a FishEye licence does not allow repositories to be started until FishEye itself has been stopped and started

fields.description:
Here is the bug that I am encountering,
1. Click on Reviews > All Reviews
2. Choose Advanced Search in Comment Search
3. Choose a certain criteria and click on Search Comments:
4. This gives me the list of comments running into multiple pages:
5. But on clicking on Page 2, the entire search criteria is reset:
6. So the list of crucibles is completely different from the list on page 1.
fields.summary: Search Criteria is reset

fields.description:
If an existing open review A includes path B from repo C, and then repo C is completely rebuilt (using, say git filter-branch to rewrite commits) and reindexed, the commit hashes associated with revisions for path B in review A may no longer be present in repo C. When adding a new revision of path B to review A, an NPE will occur as Crucible attempts to determine where in the ancestry the new revision should be placed:
{noformat}
2013-03-25 22:19:28,185 ERROR [btpool0-915 ] fisheye TotalityFilter-logExceptionDetails - Exception "java.lang.NullPointerException: Couln't find that revision with key path/to/file@aef20cab3364db96a3ac5b4903118ee200c52308 in repository REPO" (javax.servlet.ServletException) while processing "/source/cru/editRevisionsAjax.do" (Referer:"<FISHEYE_URL>/edit-changelog/~author=<author>")
{noformat}

To reproduce:

1. create a repository "A" with file at path "/foo.txt" with two revisions
2. create a review "CR-1" including a diff from "/foo.txt" from repo "A"
3. delete repo "A"
4. create a new repo "A" with a new file at path "/foo.txt" with two revisions
5. edit "CR-1" and attempt to add a new diff from "/foo.txt".
---> NPE
fields.summary: Crucible doesn't gracefully handle missing commit hashes

fields.description:
Automatic Review Creator: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugins.reviewcreator

using the auto review creation tool (which is very useful - thanks!).
by default, it is adding the text "This review was created by the Automatic Review Creator Plugin" to every review it creates. Can this either be turned off or edited?
fields.summary: Integrate the automatic review creator plugin and add improvement

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce with JIRA + Crucible:
# Create a test project in Crucible (eg. CRTEST).
# Link the project to a JIRA project.
# In the JIRA project, select the "+" in the source tab. The create review dialog opens. The selected project is CRTEST. Do not select "Start Review".
# Check the reviews in CRTEST. The CRTEST-1 review already exists.

The review should only be created after the user selects a confirmation button in the create review popup in JIRA. The user can't be expected to know that selecting the "+" button already creates the review and that his only options after that are to abandon or start the review.

Note: This is also valid without JIRA integration as the "Create Review" button in FishEye/Crucible has the same behaviour.
fields.summary: Create Reviews in Crucible Only After Confirmation

fields.description:
Defects raised in a review could be treated as tasks for the author of changes. Depending on the configuration we could eventually prevent the review from being closed before all the defects have been treated.

If JIRA is integrated with Crucible the defect could be used for light tasks (typos, formatting) while JIRA issues can be raised for more significant pieces of work.
fields.summary: I should be able to treat defects as a list of pending tasks for the author of changes in a review
Progress Tracking for Crucible Index Re-Index with other SCMs
